qas.question: When was the University Musical Society founded?
How many events does the University Musical Society present in a year?
When was the Ann Arbor civic Ballet established?
Name Michigan's first Civic chartered company.
What society was found in 1897 in Ann Arbor?
What ballet company was established in 1945?
What organization presents over 6 events each year?
What Civic Theatre is associated with the university?
What is the name of the yearly event featuring Shakespeare that started in 2011?

context: Several performing arts groups and facilities are on the University of Michigan's campus, as are museums dedicated to art, archaeology, and natural history and sciences. Founded in <a0_0>1879<a0_0/>, <b4_0><b6_0>the University Musical Society<b6_0/><b4_0/> is an independent performing arts organization that presents <a1_0>over 60<a1_0/> events each year, bringing international artists in music, dance, and theater. Since 2001 <b8_0>Shakespeare in the Arb<b8_0/> has presented one play by Shakespeare each June, in a large park near downtown. Regional and local performing arts groups not associated with the university include the <b7_0>Ann Arbor Civic Theatre<b7_0/>, the Arbor Opera Theater, the Ann Arbor Symphony Orchestra, the Ann Arbor Ballet Theater, the <a3_0><b5_0>Ann Arbor Civic Ballet<b5_0/><a3_0/> (established in <a2_0>1954<a2_0/> as Michigan's first chartered ballet company), The Ark, and Performance Network Theatre. Another unique piece of artistic expression in Ann Arbor is the fairy doors. These small portals are examples of installation art and can be found throughout the downtown area.
